meanings.def: a character in the Sherlock Holmes stories by Arthur Conan Doyle. He is the clever but evil enemy of Sherlock Holmes. In a story published in 1894 both of them fall to their deaths after a fight on a cliff path, though Conan Doyle later brought Holmes 'back to life' by writing that he had survived the fall. This was because the public was so keen for more Holmes stories.
a university teacher of the highest rank
examples: professor of something to be appointed professor of economics at Cambridge
He was made (a) professor at the age of 40.

meanings.def: a teacher at a university or college
examples: professor of something a professor of psychology/political science
She was my professor when I was a grad student.
a research professor at the University of Southern California
a respected law professor at a prestigious university
She is a former history professor.
The report was written by two Harvard professors.
He is a distinguished professor of law at the University of Illinois.
